column2: ENGLISH
One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, \n\nOne Ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them.
“It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.”
That there's some good in this world, Mr. Frodo and it's worth fighting for. - Sam Gamgee
column3: Il y a du bon en ce monde, Monsieur Frodon, il faut se battre pour cela. - Sam Gamegie

column2: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future. - Galadriel
column3: Même la plus petite personne peux changer le cours de l'avenir. - Galadriel

column2: We swears, to serve the master of the Precious. We will swear on the Precious. - Gollum
column3: Nous jurons de servir le Maître du précieux. Et nous le jurons. Oh ! Oui sur le précieux. - Gollum

column2: I am Gandalf the White. And I come back to you now at the turn of the tide. - Gandalf the White
Oh, it's quite simple. If you are a friend, you speak the password, and the doors will open. - Gandalf the Grey
For the time will soon come when Hobbits will shape the fortunes of all. - Galadriel
column3: Bientôt viendra un moment où les hobbits détermineront le sort de tous. - Galadriel

column2: There is no curse in Elvish, Entish, or the tongues of Men for this treachery. - Treebeard
column3: Il n'y a pas de jurons en elfique, entique ou langage des Hommes pour qualifier cette traîtrise. - Sylvebarbe

column2: A day may come when the courage of men fails but it is not this day! - Aragorn
column3: Un jour viendra où le courage des hommes vacillera... Mais pas aujourd'hui! - Aragorn

column2: The Ring has awoken, it heards its masters call - Gandalf the Grey
column3: L'anneau s'est réveillé, il a entendu l'appel de son maître. - Gandalf

column2: Your time will come. You will face the same Evil, and you will defeat it. - Arwen
column3: Votre temps viendra. Vous ferez face à ce même mal, et vous le vaincrez. Arwen

column2: The board is set, the pieces are moving. We come to it at last, the great battle of our time. - Gandalf the White
But the fat Hobbit, he knows. Eyes always watching. - Gollum
I thought up an ending for my book. And he lives happily ever after, till the end of his days. - Bilbo Baggins
You are the luckiest, the canniest, and the most reckless man I ever knew. Bless you, laddie. - Gimli
One does not simply walk into Mordor. - Boromir
It's my Precious! - Gollum
You shall not pass! - Gandalf the Grey
Many live that deserve death, and some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Be not too eager to deal out death in judgement. Even the very wise cannot see all ends. - Gandalf
I would have followed you, my brother... my captain... my King. - Boromir
A wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to. - Gandalf the Grey
“And some things that should not have been forgotten were lost. History became legend. Legend became myth. And for two and a half thousand years, the ring? passed out of all knowledge.”
Ash nazg durbatulûk, ash nazg gimbatul, \n\n ash nazg thrakatulûk, agh burzum-ishi krimpatul.
“Where there's life there's hope, and need of vittles.”

“I am old, Gandalf. I don't look it, but I am beginning to feel it in my heart of hearts. Well-preserved indeed! Why, I feel all thin, sort of stretched, if you know what I mean: like butter that has been scraped over too much bread. That can't be right. I need a change, or something.”
“Pay heed to the tales of old wives. It may well be that they alone keep in memory what it was once needful for the wise to know.”
I don't know what strength is in my blood but I swear to you I won't let the White City fall nor our people fail. Be at peace son of Gondor."" - Aragorn"
It's a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing. Such a little thing. - Boromir
I will take it. I will take it. I will take the ring to Mordor. - Frodo Baggins
I give you the light of Earendil, our most beloved star. May it be a light for you in dark places where all other lights go out. - Galadriel

“The enemy? His sense of duty was no less than yours, I deem. You wonder what his name is, where he came from. And if he was really evil at heart. What lies or threats led him on this long march from home. If he would not rather have stayed there in peace. War will make corpses of us all.”
Look to my coming on the first light of the fifth day. At dawn, look to the east. - Gandalf
The Road goes ever on and on, Out from the door where it began. \n\n Now far ahead the Road has gone. Let others follow, if they can!
“Home is behind, the world ahead, and there are many paths to tread \n\nthrough shadows to the edge of night, until the stars are all alight.”
Against the power of Mordor there can be no victory! - Saruman
I do not know half of you as well as I should like. I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve. - Bilbo Baggins
Drums, drums in the deep. We cannot get out... they are coming.
I would cut off your head, dwarf, if it stood but a little higher from the ground. - Eomer
We'll be nice to them if they'll be nice to us... - Gollum
All our hopes now lie with two little Hobbits somewhere in the wilderness. - Gandalf
The Horn of Helm Hammerhand will sound in the deep one last time! - Theoden
column3: Le cor du Gouffre va retentir une dernière fois! - Théoden

column2: I am Saruman. Or rather, as he should have been. - Gandalf
column3: Je suis Saroumane. Ou plutôt ce qu'il aurait du être. - Gandalf

column2: Death! Death! Death! - Rohirrim Charge
column3: A mort! A mort! A mort! - Charge des Rohirrim

column2: They will answer to the King... of Gondor. - Elrond
column3: Ils répondront au Roi du Gondor! - Elrond

column2: Let this be the hour when we draw swords together. - Theoden
column3: Il est l'heure de brandir nos épées ensemble! Théoden

column2: They are taking the Hobbits to Isengard! - Legolas
column3: Ils emmenent les Hobbits en Isengard! - Legolas

column2: I AM NO MAN! - Eowyn
column3: Je ne suis pas un Homme! - Eowyn

column2: That still only counts as one! - Gimli
column3: Cela ne compte quand même que pour un! - Gimli

column2: Po-ta-toes! Boil 'em, mash 'em, stick 'em in a stew! - Sam Gamgee
What can men do against such reckless hate? - Theoden
Where now are the horse and the rider? Where is the horn that was blowing? - Theoden
I was there three thousand years ago. I was there the day the strength of men failed. - Elrond
In a dream, I saw the Eastern sky grow dark, but in the West a pale light lingered. A voice was crying, "The doom is near at hand, Isildur's Bane is found." - Boromir
